speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: SCENE VI. Near the camp of Cominius.

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Enter COMINIUS, as it were in retire, with soldiers

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Breathe you, my friends: well fought;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: we are come off

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Like Romans, neither foolish in our stands,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Nor cowardly in retire: believe me, sirs,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: We shall be charged again. Whiles we have struck,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: By interims and conveying gusts we have heard

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The charges of our friends. Ye Roman gods!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Lead their successes as we wish our own,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That both our powers, with smiling

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: fronts encountering,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: May give you thankful sacrifice.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Thy news?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The citizens of Corioli have issued,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And given to Lartius and to Marcius battle:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: I saw our party to their trenches driven,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And then I came away.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Though thou speak'st truth,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Methinks thou speak'st not well.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: How long is't since?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Above an hour, my lord.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: 'Tis not a mile; briefly we heard their drums:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: How couldst thou in a mile confound an hour,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And bring thy news so late?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Spies of the Volsces

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Held me in chase, that I was forced to wheel

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Three or four miles about, else had I, sir,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Half an hour since brought my report.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Who's yonder,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That does appear as he were flay'd? O gods

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He has the stamp of Marcius; and I have

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Before-time seen him thus.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: [Within]                 Come I too late?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The shepherd knows not thunder from a tabour

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: More than I know the sound of Marcius' tongue

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: From every meaner man.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Enter MARCIUS

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Come I too late?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Ay, if you come not in the blood of others,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: But mantled in your own.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: O, let me clip ye

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: In arms as sound as when I woo'd, in heart

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As merry as when our nuptial day was done,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And tapers burn'd to bedward!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Flower of warriors,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: How is it with Titus Lartius?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As with a man busied about decrees:

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Condemning some to death, and some to exile;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Ransoming him, or pitying, threatening the other;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Holding Corioli in the name of Rome,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Even like a fawning greyhound in the leash,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: To let him slip at will.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Where is that slave

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Which told me they had beat you to your trenches?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Where is he? call him hither.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Let him alone;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: He did inform the truth: but for our gentlemen,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: The common file--a plague! tribunes for them!--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: The mouse ne'er shunn'd the cat as they did budge

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: From rascals worse than they.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: But how prevail'd you?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Will the time serve to tell? I do not think.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Where is the enemy? are you lords o' the field?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: If not, why cease you till you are so?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Marcius,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: We have at disadvantage fought and did

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Retire to win our purpose.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: How lies their battle? know you on which side

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They have placed their men of trust?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: As I guess, Marcius,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Their bands i' the vaward are the Antiates,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Of their best trust; o'er them Aufidius,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Their very heart of hope.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I do beseech you,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: By all the battles wherein we have fought,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: By the blood we have shed together, by the vows

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: We have made to endure friends, that you directly

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Set me against Aufidius and his Antiates;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And that you not delay the present, but,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Filling the air with swords advanced and darts,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: We prove this very hour.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Though I could wish

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You were conducted to a gentle bath

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And balms applied to, you, yet dare I never

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Deny your asking: take your choice of those

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That best can aid your action.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Those are they

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That most are willing. If any such be here--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As it were sin to doubt--that love this painting

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Wherein you see me smear'd; if any fear

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Lesser his person than an ill report;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: If any think brave death outweighs bad life

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And that his country's dearer than himself;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Let him alone, or so many so minded,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Wave thus, to express his disposition,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And follow Marcius.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: They all shout and wave their swords, take him up in their arms, and cast up their caps

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: O, me alone! make you a sword of me?

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: If these shows be not outward, which of you

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: But is four Volsces? none of you but is

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Able to bear against the great Aufidius

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: A shield as hard as his. A certain number,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Though thanks to all, must I select

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: from all: the rest

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Shall bear the business in some other fight,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As cause will be obey'd. Please you to march;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And four shall quickly draw out my command,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Which men are best inclined.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: March on, my fellows:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Make good this ostentation, and you shall

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Divide in all with us.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
